p: The aqueous and chloroform extracts of the aerial parts of A. vulgaris were tested by two teams from the Philippines to determine the hemodynamic potential of the plant. They found that the administration of a 10% solution of the aqueous extract into the isolated perfused mesentery of rats effectively reversed the hypertensive effect induced by noradrenaline; however, the baseline blood pressure values and heart rate remained unaltered [ 12].
